page.title: 04THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Built in 1874 (old school c1770), the school is central to life in the villages and has one teacher (Mrs.Liz. Richardson) for the 16 children who each follow an individual programme of learning.There is also a full time classroom /clerical assistant. The variety of school based activity involves many villagers:e.g. fund raising,extra teaching and joining in with school events. A local farmer entrusted us with the incubation of 120 pheasant eggs and the children benefit from his detailed knowledge of nature. Their 'human biology' lessons are given by a local J.P. We enjoy regular visits to the Green,the woods,the Arboretum & local farms. We also have close links with Peers School,a large comprehensive school in Littlemore and make good use of their excellent facilities and patronage.
